IG Seema Dhundia will head the Bihar Sector of CRPF, while IG Annie Abraham will head Rapid Action Force (RAF), the CRPF said in a statement. This is the first time that RAF will be headed by a woman.

348.title: I wish the dating rumours about me were true: Siddhant Chaturvedi
348.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, during an interview, was asked to share a rumour that he wishes were true. To this, he replied, "That I am dating, seeing someone. I wish that was true." This comes after there were rumours of Siddhant dating Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda. Siddhant will next feature in 'Phone Bhoot'.

349.title: 50-yr-old man killed as fire breaks out at paper godown in UP
349.article_body: A 50-year-old man, Lal Bahadur, was charred to death in a fire that broke out at a paper mill godown in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur in the early hours of Wednesday, police said. Bahadur, an employee, who was sleeping in the middle of paper bundles, got trapped inside and died. Property worth ₹2 crore was also destroyed, police added.

350.title: India test-fires Phase-II Ballistic Missile Defence interceptor
350.article_body: India on Wednesday conducted the successful maiden flight test of phase-II Ballistic Missile Defence (BMD) interceptor, AD-1 missile, from APJ Abdul Kalam Island in Odisha. The missile has a large kill altitude bracket. All BMD elements participated in the test. "AD-1 is a long-range interceptor missile designed for both low exo-atmospheric and endo-atmospheric interception," an official said.

351.title: SEBI's refunds to Sahara investors reach ₹138 crore since 2012
351.article_body: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has processed ₹138 crore refunds to investors of two Sahara companies since 2012. The regulator added that the amount deposited in specially-opened bank accounts for the repayment has risen to over ₹24,000 crore. SEBI segregated ₹63,206 crore in dues pertaining to PACL Ltd and a Sahara Group company as "difficult to recover".

352.title: Never saw such huge influx of bodies: Crematoriums on Morbi tragedy
352.article_body: Crematoriums and graveyards in Gujarat's Morbi said they never saw a huge influx of bodies in such a short span of time in decades as they saw after the bridge collapse. At least 135 people were killed and several others were injured after the suspension bridge on Machchhu river collapsed on Sunday. Meanwhile, search for bodies continues at the site.

353.title: Congress synonymous with corruption, mafia: UP CM Yogi in Himachal
353.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath criticised the Congress and said the party was synonymous with mafia and corruption. Addressing election rallies in Himachal Pradesh, he said it is the responsibility of people of Himachal Pradesh to keep these evils away. "The double engine government has given Himachal AIIMS, IIT, IIM, medical college...and free ration during...pandemic," he said.

354.title: Oil firms lose ₹4 per litre on diesel: Hardeep Puri on talks of price cut
354.article_body: Oil Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said PSU oil companies are losing a net ₹4 per litre on diesel, while speaking about talks of a price reduction. Puri said his ministry will seek assistance for three fuel retailers, IOC, BPCL and HPCL, for the losses they incurred on holding petrol and diesel prices since the Ukraine war to tackle inflation.

355.title: Kohli's Hindi-speaking Chinese fan cheers for him in Adelaide, says 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai'
355.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Virat Kohli and Team India's Hindi-speaking Chinese fan cheering for him in Adelaide. In the video, the fan can be heard saying, "Bharat Mata Ki Jai." The fan, who did not reveal his name, added that he learned Hindi because he loves Indian culture and is a language student at the Adelaide University.

356.title: BJP's Gautam Gambhir summoned over unauthorised construction on MCD dumping yard
356.article_body: A Delhi court has issued summon to BJP MP Gautam Gambhir over alleged unauthorised construction of a library on MCD land meant to be a dumping yard. The library has been constructed near Karkardooma court. As per summon, Gambhir must appear before the court on December 13. The petitioners are seeking an order to restrain Gambhir from using the library.

357.title: Never been abusive with Kejriwal: Delhi L-G office
357.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has never been abusive in his communication with Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, a statement from Raj Niwas stated on Wednesday. "On the contrary, even in matters of extreme breach of propriety or blatant verbal misconduct on part of the CM, his ministers and members of AAP, the L-G has...refrained from any comment," it added.

358.title: Rahul plays cricket with boy during Bharat Jodo Yatra, shares video
358.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted a video of him playing cricket with a boy on a road in Hyderabad during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. The boy was seen wearing a jersey of Team India. Rahul tweeted, "Donning the India jersey...makes you unbeatable. Well played #TeamIndia!" This comes after Team India defeated Bangladesh in the T20 World Cup 2022.

359.title: Teaser of 'Pathaan' copied from other films, claim Twitter users; share pics
359.article_body: After the teaser of 'Pathaan' was released, several Twitter users called out the makers for copying scenes from movies like 'WAR' and 'Captain America: The Winter Soldier'. They shared comparison pictures and pointed out resemblances. "Why [do]...action sequences in 'Pathaan' teaser keep reminding me of 'Winter Soldier'," a tweet read. Others also pointed out similarities with 'Dus' and 'Saaho'.

360.title: Encouraged to be recognized worldwide: Prateik on 'Four...' Emmy nomination
360.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar, speaking about his show 'Four More Shots Please!' getting nominated at the International Emmy Award for Comedy in 2020, has said that it was extremely encouraging to be recognised worldwide. "There's a benchmark that has been set...we need to take it up a notch," the actor added. The show also featured Bani J and Kirti Kulhari.

361.title: Very little to do: Goa CBI on not having enough cases
361.article_body: The anti-corruption branch of Goa's Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) said that it has "very little to do" as there aren't enough cases. The superintendent of police heading the team of five officers said that the last bribery case they received was in 2018. SP (CBI) Ashesh Kumar said that over the last year, only three cases were registered.

362.title: Taking DNA of rape accused for probe not violation of his right: Kerala HC
362.article_body: The Kerala HC has said that a rape accused being asked to provide his DNA for criminal probe doesn't violate his constitutional right against self-incrimination. Justice Kauser Edappagath said the privilege of Article 20(3) is applicable only to testimonial evidence. The HC upheld a trial court's order urging a rape accused to provide his blood sample for a paternity test.

363.title: BYJU'S plans $1 billion IPO of subsidiary Aakash next fiscal: Report
363.article_body: BYJU'S is planning to list its subsidiary Aakash, an offline coaching chain, in the first half of next year, Moneycontrol reported. The size of the IPO could be in the range of $1 billion, valuing Aakash at $3.5-$4 billion. According to the report, BYJU'S plans to list by June 2024, or the first half of FY24.

364.title: SEBI categorises dues worth ₹67,228 crore as 'difficult to recover'
364.article_body: SEBI has segregated dues of ₹67,228 crore under "difficult to recover" category at the end of March 2022. Overall, SEBI has to recover ₹96,609 crore from entities including those that failed to pay the fine imposed on them, failed to pay fees due to markets watchdog and did not comply with its direction to refund investors' money.

365.title: Ranveer Singh invited to represent India at FIFA World Cup final: Report
365.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has reportedly been invited to represent India at the FIFA World Cup 2022 final in Qatar. A source told Bollywood Hungama, "Ranveer has become a cultural phenomenon globally. He represents the aspirational youth of India globally...is the perfect ambassador to be there at the FIFA World Cup final." The final will take place on December 18.

366.title: We don't want our partners to watch us die of cold live on TV: Ukraine
366.article_body: Senior Ukrainian adviser Mykhailo Podolyak has said western allies must speed up delivery of defensive weapons to protect energy infrastructure in the war-torn nation. "[They must] transfer as quickly as possible...defensive weapons so that Russia doesn't kill [Ukrainians] by freezing them to death," he said. "We don't want our partners to watch us dying from...cold live on TV," he added.

367.title: BYJU'S announces business expansion, to hire 600 in Kerala
367.article_body: BYJU'S has announced plans to expand business in Kerala and hire 600 people in the state following Founder Byju Raveendran's meeting with Chief Minister P Vijayan. The company said it will add three more offices in the state in this financial year, taking the total number to 14. The company also revoked its plan to shut down the Thiruvananthapuram office.

368.title: Voting in byelections to 7 assembly seats in 6 states on Thursday
368.article_body: Bypolls to seven seats in six states will be held on Thursday (November 3). The bypolls will be held in Munugode (Telangana), Andheri East (Maharashtra), Mokama (Bihar), Gopalganj (Bihar), Adampur (Haryana), Gola Gokrannath (Uttar Pradesh) and Dhamnagar (Odisha). The polls were necessitated due to the sitting legislator's death or resignation from elected party or due to a criminal conviction.

369.title: Elon Musk's net worth has fallen $9 billion since Twitter takeover
369.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk's net worth has dropped about $9 billion since he took over Twitter on October 28, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk's net worth fell to $203 billion, down nearly 25% since the beginning of 2022. However, Musk is still the world's richest person, ahead of world's second richest person Bernard Arnault by around $65 billion.

370.title: Blue tick on Twitter is signifier of clout: CRED founder Kunal Shah
370.article_body: After Twitter's new owner Elon Musk announced $8/month price for blue tick, CRED Founder Kunal Shah called the tick a "signifier of clout" and said the decision would end in chaos. "Those with clout will lose their clout if they appear to be paying for this vanity badge...Those with no clout will buy...and try to appear important," Shah tweeted.

371.title: Look at rupee depreciation sans emotions: Shaktikanta Das
371.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das appealed to people to look at the depreciation of the rupee without any emotions and in the context of the current geopolitical crisis. He added that in comparison with other major currencies, the rupee has depreciated less. "The rupee has seen a very orderly movement since the onset of the current geopolitical crisis," Das added.

372.title: Google Chrome adds new sidebar for faster search results
372.article_body: Google has launched a new sidebar in Chrome that can make it faster and easier to check out search results without moving back and forth between multiple tabs. Users can click "Open search in side panel", which will display results in a side panel. The feature is reportedly similar to Microsoft Edge's sidebar.

373.title: Stalin like my brother, couldn't leave without meeting him: Mamata
373.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that Tamil Nadu counterpart MK Stalin is like her brother and she couldn't have left Chennai without meeting him. "I came to attend a family function but could not have left without meeting with Stalin...we did not discuss anything about politics," Mamata told ANI. The two leaders met at Stalin's residence.

374.title: Explore how specially-abled people can be in civil services: SC to Centre
374.article_body: The Supreme Court asked the Centre to explore how specially-abled people can be put under different categories in the civil services. A bench of Justices SA Nazeer and V Ramasubramanian said, "You please examine. They may not fit into all categories. Sympathy is one aspect, practicality is another aspect." Attorney General R Venkataramani sought time to look into the matter.

375.title: Poland to build temporary barrier along its border with Russia
375.article_body: Poland's Defence Minister Mariusz Blaszczak said the construction of a temporary barrier along the country's border with Russia will begin on Wednesday. The barrier, which will be 2.5 m high and 3 m deep, will be built along the Russian exclave of Kaliningrad, said Blaszczak. The barrier's construction will be completed by the end of 2023.

376.title: Yograj Singh joins Haasan's 'Indian 2', says 'Lion of Punjab is ready'
376.article_body: Former India cricketer Yograj Singh took to Instagram and announced that he will feature in Kamal Haasan's 'Indian 2'. He shared a picture of himself in the makeup room. Along with the picture, Yograj wrote, "Big respect to all heroes behind the camera...The Lion of Punjab is ready for 'Indian 2'...with Kamal Haasan ji (legend)."

377.title: Meghalaya CM Conrad K Sangma's chopper makes emergency landing
377.article_body: Meghalaya CM Conrad K Sangma's helicopter made an emergency landing near Shillong due to inclement weather on Wednesday, officials said. Sangma was flying from Tura to Shillong, an official said. "Emergency landing at UCC (Union Christian College) in Umiam...but enjoyed the view of the lovely campus during my walk...what a day!" Sangma tweeted.

378.title: Dy CM Fadnavis' wife urges Maha govt to not provide her traffic clearance vehicle
378.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta Fadnavis on Wednesday requested Mumbai Police to not provide her a traffic clearance pilot vehicle. It was provided to her as part of her security upgrade cleared by the state's Home Department, headed by Devendra Fadnavis. "I am and wish to live like a common citizen of Mumbai," she said.

379.title: How can Pakistan still qualify for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals?
379.article_body: Pakistan are currently placed fifth on T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 2 points table. To advance, Pakistan would need to beat South Africa and Bangladesh, and would need India or South Africa to lose their final Super 12 match. In case South Africa and India win, Pakistan would be knocked out even if they win their remaining matches.

380.title: Which multiple T20 World Cup records does Virat Kohli hold?
380.article_body: Virat Kohli today broke the record for scoring most runs (1,065) in T20 World Cup history. Kohli also holds the record for the highest batting average (88.75) in T20 World Cup history. Further, he has hit most fifties (13) in T20 World Cups. Kohli also has the most Player of the Match awards (seven) in the tournament history.

381.title: Let 'KGF' be our mantra: Piyush Goyal as he invites people to invest in Karnataka
381.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal, while speaking at the Invest Karnataka summit, invited people to invest in Karnataka by saying, "Let KGF be our mantra - Karnataka Growth & Future." Goyal said, "Wherever I go, there's great excitement about Karnataka." He added, "There's a large amount of investor interest leading to the investment potential of at least ₹7 lakh crore."

382.title: Was told 'Industry will not get you back if you take break': Sarika
382.article_body: Actress Sarika said that her friends panicked when she decided to take a break from her acting career for a year. "My friends...told me, 'Don't be stupid! This industry...will not get you back'," she added. "I was like...if I am offered an old woman's role, I would happily take that up as well. I just wanted to act," she stated.

383.title: Saddened by death of Ela Bhatt, she'll long be remembered: PM Modi
383.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled the death of 89-year-old women's rights activist Ela Bhatt who passed away on Wednesday. The PM tweeted, "Saddened by the death of Elaben Bhatt. She will long be remembered for her efforts to promote women's empowerment, social service, and education among the youth...Om Shanti." Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said, "She devoted her life to Gandhian ideals."

384.title: Jairam Thakur is HP's accidental CM, even Biden can't save him: Oppn leader
384.article_body: Ahead of the Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh, Leader of Opposition Mukesh Agnihotri called CM Jairam Thakur an "accidental CM". Agnihotri stated that Thakur's government has been a non-performing one, further claiming that the latter is dependent on PM Narendra Modi's support for survival. "No one can save [Thakur] now, not even [US President] Joe Biden," Agnihotri said.

385.title: We see no signs that Russia is preparing to use nuclear weapons: US
385.article_body: White House spokesman John Kirby has said the US doesn't see any signs that Russia is making preparations to use nuclear weapons in Ukraine. Kirby said, "We've been clear...that Russia's comments about the potential use of nuclear weapons are deeply concerning." "We...monitor this as best we can and...see no indications that Russia is making preparations for such use," he added.

386.title: Craze for glimpse of SRK's 'Pathaan' has been unprecedented: Director
386.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand has said that there was no better day to release the teaser of 'Pathaan' than Shah Rukh Khan's birthday. "The craze for a glimpse of 'Pathaan' has been unprecedented. After a long, long time there's [an] insane buzz for a film that's genuine and organic...it's all due to the super stardom of...Shah Rukh," he added.

387.title: Amazon's m-cap falls below $1-trillion mark for first time since April 2020
387.article_body: Shares of e-commerce firm Amazon fell on Tuesday, taking the firm's market capitalisation (m-cap) below the $1-trillion mark for the first time since April 2020. Amazon's stock fell 5.5% to close at $96.79 at an m-cap of $987.4 billion. This comes after Amazon reported its earnings last week, when it projected the slowest July-September quarter growth in its history.

388.title: UK sanctions 4 Russian steel, petrochemical tycoons funding Putin's war
388.article_body: UK has sanctioned four Russian steel and petrochemical business owners "who rely on Russian President Vladimir Putin for their positions of authority and fund his military machine", Foreign Secretary James Cleverly said. "[We're] ramping up the economic pressure on Putin and will...do so until Ukraine prevails," he said. Those sanctioned include Alexander Frolov, ex-CEO of steel producer Evraz.

389.title: Video shows EVM, chairs being thrown as men clash during Haryana panchayat polls
389.article_body: Clashes broke out between two groups during polling for the panchayat election in Zahidpur village of Haryana's Jhajjar district on Wednesday. A video has surfaced showing some people throwing chairs at each other. They were also seen throwing an electronic voting machine (EVM) and election materials. An EVM was damaged in the incident.

390.title: 153 commercial premises in Thane fined for lacking Marathi signboards
390.article_body: As many as 153 shops and commercial establishments in Maharashtra's Thane district have been fined for not displaying signboards in the Marathi language. Thane Deputy Labour Commissioner Santosh Bhosale said 15 of the 153 establishments were fined ₹3.49 lakh. As per the state government's directives, all commercial establishments and shops are expected to display signboards in Marathi.

391.title: Can tackle attrition by seeking new talent sources: Rishad Premji
391.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said the IT sector faces high level of attrition because companies chase the same talent pool. In order to widen the talent pool, he said that new locations and sources must be sought and flexibility of remote work should be provided. He added that to tackle attrition they should also reskill existing pool with new-age technologies.

392.title: 2 men stripped, paraded and whipped for selling beef in Chhattisgarh; video surfaces
392.article_body: Two men were stripped, paraded and whipped with a belt for allegedly selling beef in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur district. The two men have been arrested and police said over 33 kg of beef was recovered from them. There is also no information on whether any action has been taken against the men involved in whipping them.

393.title: IIT alumni founded AlmaBetter raises $2.7 mn from Kalaari Capital, others
393.article_body: Upskilling startup AlmaBetter raised $2.7 million in a seed round led by Kalaari Capital. The round also saw participation from investors such as Vidit Aatrey (CEO, Meesho), Sanjeev Barnwal (CTO, Meesho) and Varun Alagh (CEO, MamaEarth), among others. AlmaBetter was founded by IIT Delhi and Kharagpur alumni Shivam Dutta, Vikash Srivastava, Ravi Kumar Gupta, Arshyan Ahsan and Alok Anand.

394.title: 16-yr-old electrocuted to death at coaching centre in Odisha's Kendrapara
394.article_body: A 16-year-old student, Debi Prasad Dash, was electrocuted to death after coming in contact with a high-tension wire at a residential coaching centre in Odisha's Kendrapara, police said on Wednesday. Dash, a resident of Gopinath village, accidentally came in contact with an 11 KV line. The deceased's family members have filed an FIR against the coaching centre authorities alleging negligence.

395.title: Congress' promise to restore old pension scheme is a bait: Himachal CM
395.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur criticised Congress over its promise to restore the old pension scheme, calling it a bait and said the scheme was ended during Congress leader Virbhadra Singh's government. "Now their eyes are on the vote...they feel that something can be done by giving inducements," Thakur said, questioning why the scheme wasn't restarted between 2013 and 2017.

396.title: Hackers send fake mails to exploit Musk's plan to charge for blue tick
396.article_body: Hackers are sending phishing emails to lure Twitter users for a blue tick in an attempt to get their account credentials, according to a report. The phishing attacks began after Twitter's new owner Elon Musk announced an $8 monthly fee for a blue tick in subscribers' accounts. The emails have "don’t lose your free verified status" in the subject line.

397.title: Unverified screenshot on Covid curb easing causes $450 bn stock rally in China
397.article_body: An unverified screenshot of four paragraphs detailing China's reopening plan following the lawmakers' meeting with COVID-19 experts went viral in China, causing a $450-billion rally in stocks. The screenshot, with no identifying marks, began circulating on Monday night in WeChat groups filled with analysts and fund managers. Prominent economists and financial platforms also shared the screenshot.

398.title: Lotus Herbals acquires 20% stake in startup Yogic Secrets
398.article_body: Lotus Herbals said that it has acquired a 20% stake in direct-to-consumer nutraceuticals and health supplement startup Yogic Secrets Healthcare for an undisclosed amount. According to a joint statement, Yogic Secrets will use the funds to scale up its operations in India and also expand globally. This is Lotus' fifth investment in emerging brands in the beauty and wellness space.

399.title: Pregnancy may change woman’s bones forever: Study
399.article_body: A study has found that pregnancy can permanently change the makeup of a woman’s bones. Anthropologists have discovered that female primates who had babies show reduced levels of calcium and phosphorus as compared to those who have not reproduced. A significant drop in magnesium levels as a result of breastfeeding was also noticed in their bones.

400.title: Google to discontinue its dedicated Street View app in 2023: Report
400.article_body: Google has announced plans to discontinue its dedicated Street View app on Android next year. According to a report by 9to5Google, the company has prepared a notice to advice users to shift to Google Maps or Street View Studio. The app, launched in July in India, allows users to explore an area through 360-degree panoramic street-level images.

401.title: Another Maharashtra transport bus catches fire; all 43 passengers safe
401.article_body: A Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) bus carrying 43 passengers caught fire in Maharashtra's Nashik on Wednesday. The bus driver immediately stopped the bus on the side of the Sinnar-Nashik-Pune road and pulled out all the passengers. A similar incident took place in Pune on Tuesday.

402.title: MP official, yet to receive govt bungalow, living in tent for 3 months
402.article_body: The panchayat chief of a Madhya Pradesh district has been living in a tent for the past three months as he is yet to get a government bungalow. Rudesh Paraste from Dindori district told ANI that he's attending to the residents' problems while living in the tent. "We're facing many issues but will manage to serve the public," he said.
